title: Authors and Citation
text: Christopher T. Kenny. Author, maintainer. Cory McCartan. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kenny C, McCartan C (2026). redistio: Interactive Redistricting. R package version 0.0.0.9001, https://github.com/christopherkenny/redistio.
code: @Manual{,   title = {redistio: Interactive Redistricting},   author = {Christopher T. Kenny and Cory McCartan},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9001},   url = {https://github.com/christopherkenny/redistio}, }

title: Interactive Redistricting
text: redistio provides point--click districting interface powered Shiny mapgl. regular sf objects, can used draw districts export assignment files. redist_map objects, algorithmic assistance enabled map drawing. also includes interactive adjacency graph editor via adj_editor().

title: Interactive Redistricting
text: can install development version redistio GitHub : R-universe :
code: pak::pak('christopherkenny/redistio') install.packages('redistio', repos = c('https://christopherkenny.r-universe.dev', 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))

title: Interactive Redistricting
text: basic application redistio starts sf tibble column district assignments.
code: library(redistio)  draw(dc, dc$ward)

title: Interactive Redistricting
text: working redist_map objects redist_plans, can pass pre-computed plans draw() browsing comparison. enables two additional tabs app: Plans: Browse preview simulated plans map, adopt plan current working plan. Comparisons: Compare current plan simulated plans using summary statistics plots. plans_fn argument accepts function adds current plan redist_plans object computes summary statistics comparison. built-add_plan_stats() function handles automatically, computing statistics like population parity, compactness, partisan metrics, administrative splits match whatever columns present plans.
code: library(redistio) library(redist)  map <- redist_map(dc, existing_plan = ward) plans <- redist_smc(map, nsims = 100)  draw(map, init_plan = map$ward, plans = plans, plans_fn = add_plan_stats)

title: Interactive Redistricting
text: redistio includes interactive adjacency graph editor fixing adjacency issues data (e.g., removing edges across rivers adding edges missing connections): editor lets add remove edges clicking pairs precincts, provides export tab edit log reproducible code using geomander functions.
code: library(redistio)  adj_editor(dc, init_plan = dc$ward)

title: Interactive Redistricting
text: editor can configured primarily redistio_options(). configurable options: theme: bslib theme use panels: panels include. Allows removing panels like elections, drawing districts party-blind manner palette_party: colors use partisan maps palette_pop: colors use population maps palette_pct: colors use percentage maps. Diverging palettes recommended. map_tiles: base map style function use mapgl use_algorithms: whether enable algorithmic assistance map drawing. Requires redist_map object. alg_max_districts: maximum number districts allowed algorithmic simulations alg_max_sims: maximum number simulations allowed algorithmic simulations use_plans: whether show plans browser tab plans provided draw() use_comparisons: whether show comparisons tab plans plans_fn provided draw() use_planscore: whether use PlanScore API evaluate plans. Requires internet access PlanScore key. locked_districts: districts lock app start, preventing edits districts projection: Maplibre map projection use (default 'mercator')

title: Interactive Redistricting
text: Several data-based options may configured inside draw(): layers: Columns use toggle layers, can show things like county lines shapes elect_cols: Specify election columns directly. use guessing approach follows ALARM Project column naming schema default. demog_cols: Specify demographic columns directly. use guessing approach follows ALARM Project column naming schema default. split_cols: Specify columns contain administrative units check splits . hover_fn: function display precinct-data based row shp mouse . plans: redist_plans object browsing comparison. plans_fn: function add reference plan compute summary statistics (e.g., add_plan_stats()).

title: Interactive Redistricting
text: features allow analyzing complex maps, live comparisons simulations. example, following code, can many options:
code: library(redistio) nj <- alarmdata::alarm_50state_map('NJ') pl <- alarmdata::alarm_50state_plans('NJ') draw(   nj,   init_plan = nj$cd_2020,   palette = ggredist::ggredist$alaska,   layers = list(County = 'county'),   plans = pl,   plans_fn = add_plan_stats )

what: Add summary statistics to plans — add_plan_stats
title: Add summary statistics to plans — add_plan_stats
text: Add summary statistics plans

title: Add summary statistics to plans — add_plan_stats
code: add_plan_stats(plans, ref_plan, map = NULL, name = NULL, ...)

title: Add summary statistics to plans — add_plan_stats
text: plans redist_plans object ref_plan integer vector district assignments map redist_map object. Required plans contains summary statistics. name name reference plan. Defaults "ref". ... additional arguments (currently ignored)

title: Add summary statistics to plans — add_plan_stats
text: redist_plans object reference plan added

title: Add summary statistics to plans — add_plan_stats
code: dc_map <- redist::redist_map(dc, existing_plan = ward) #> Projecting to CRS 3857 plans <- redist::redist_smc(dc_map, nsims = 10) #> Loading required package: redistmetrics #>  #> Attaching package: ‘redist’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter #> SEQUENTIAL MONTE CARLO #> Sampling 10 143-unit maps with 8 districts and population between 80790 and 91596. #> Split [0/7] ■                                | ETA? #> Split [7/7] ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■  | ETA 0s #>  plans <- add_plan_stats(plans, dc_map$ward, map = dc_map, name = 'example')

title: Interactive Adjacency Graph Editing — adj_editor
text: Interactive Adjacency Graph Editing

title: Interactive Adjacency Graph Editing — adj_editor
code: adj_editor(   shp,   adj = geomander::adjacency(shp),   init_plan,   palette = NULL,   layers = NULL,   hover_fn = hover_precinct,   opts = redistio_options() )

title: Interactive Adjacency Graph Editing — adj_editor
text: shp sf tibble want draw adj zero-indexed adjacency graph init_plan plan initialize coloring palette Color palette fill shapes . Default Polychrome 36 , installed, crayons::crayons$no_48. layers Named list sf objects overlay. Also takes column names shp group . hover_fn Function generate tables mouse hovering. Default hover_precinct(). opts list options. Default redistio_options()

title: Interactive Adjacency Graph Editing — adj_editor
text: Shiny app

title: Interactive Adjacency Graph Editing — adj_editor
code: if (interactive()) {   adj_editor(dc, init_plan = dc$ward)   adj_editor(dc, init_plan = dc$ward, layers = list(neighborhoods = 'adv_nbr')) }

what: District of Columbia Geographic Data — dc
title: District of Columbia Geographic Data — dc
text: file contains demographic, partisan, geographic data DC voting district level.

title: District of Columbia Geographic Data — dc
text: sf object GEOID20 US Census Geographic Identifier state state abbreviation county county name vtd voting district identifier pop total population pop_hisp Hispanic population pop_white White, non-Hispanic population pop_black Black, non-Hispanic population pop_aian American Indian Alaskan Native, non-Hispanic population pop_asian Asian, non-Hispanic population pop_nhpi Native Hawaiian Pacific Islander, non-Hispanic population pop_other , non-Hispanic population pop_two Two Races, non-Hispanic population vap voting age population vap_hisp Hispanic voting age population vap_white White, non-Hispanic voting age population vap_black Black, non-Hispanic voting age population vap_aian American Indian Alaskan Native, non-Hispanic voting age population vap_asian Asian, non-Hispanic voting age population vap_nhpi Native Hawaiian Pacific Islander, non-Hispanic voting age population vap_other , non-Hispanic voting age population vap_two Two Races, non-Hispanic voting age population pre_16_dem_cli votes Clinton 2016, President (D) pre_16_rep_tru votes Trump 2016, President (R) uss_18_dem_bro votes Brown 2018, Shadow Senate (D) atg_18_dem_rac votes Karl Racine, Attorney General (D) pre_20_dem_bid votes Biden 2020, President (D) pre_20_rep_tru votes Trump 2020, President (R) uss_20_dem_str votes Strauss 2020, Shadow Senate (D) uss_20_rep_wei votes Weiss 2020, Shadow Senate (R) arv_16 average Republican vote 2016 adv_16 average Democratic vote 2016 arv_18 average Republican vote 2018 adv_18 average Democratic vote 2016 arv_20 average Republican vote 2020 adv_20 average Democratic vote 2016 nrv normal Republican vote ndv normal Democratic vote geometry sf geometry adv_nbr Advisory Neighborhood names estimated VTDs ward 2022 ward lines estimated VTDs

title: District of Columbia Geographic Data — dc
code: data(dc)

title: Interactive Plan Drawing — draw
text: Interactive Plan Drawing

title: Interactive Plan Drawing — draw
code: draw(   shp,   init_plan,   ndists,   palette = NULL,   layers = NULL,   pop_tol = 0.05,   pop_col = "pop",   adj_col = "adj",   split_cols = guess_admins,   elect_cols = guess_elections,   demog_cols = guesstimate_demographics,   plans = NULL,   plans_fn = NULL,   hover_fn = hover_precinct,   opts = redistio_options() )

title: Interactive Plan Drawing — draw
text: shp sf tibble want draw init_plan Plan initialize . ndists Number districts draw init_plan supplied. palette Color palette fill shapes . Default Polychrome 36 , installed, crayons::crayons$no_48. layers Named list sf objects overlay. Also takes column names shp group . pop_tol population tolerance. pop_col Name column shp contains population data. adj_col Name column shp contains adjacency information. split_cols Names column shp contain administrative units elect_cols Names column shp contain election data demog_cols Names column shp contain demographic data plans redist_plans object plans browsing comparison plans_fn function add reference plan plans compute summary statistics. follow signature add_plan_stats(). hover_fn Function generate tables mouse hovering. Default hover_precinct(). opts list options. Default redistio_options()

title: Interactive Plan Drawing — draw
text: Shiny app

title: Interactive Plan Drawing — draw
code: if (interactive()) {   draw(dc, dc$ward)   draw(dc, dc$ward, layers = list(neighborhoods = 'adv_nbr')) }

what: Create a tibble of precinct stats — hover_precinct
title: Create a tibble of precinct stats — hover_precinct
text: Create tibble precinct stats

title: Create a tibble of precinct stats — hover_precinct
code: hover_precinct(shp, ...)

title: Create a tibble of precinct stats — hover_precinct
text: shp tibble::tibble precinct stats ... named tidyselections

title: Create a tibble of precinct stats — hover_precinct
text: tibble::tibble columns group, rowname, one column per precinct (V1, V2, ...). Groups labeled human-readable names (e.g. "Total Population", "Voting Age Population").

title: Create a tibble of precinct stats — hover_precinct
Set options for redistio — redistio_options
text: Set options redistio

title: Set options for redistio — redistio_options
code: redistio_options(   theme = "flatly",   panels = c("elections", "demographics", "integrity", "algorithms", "plans",     "comparisons"),   select_color = "purple",   border_color = "#000000",   palette_pop = "Purples",   palette_pct = "PuOr",   palette_party = ggredist::ggredist$partisan,   map_tiles = mapgl::carto_style("voyager"),   leaflet_height = "91vh",   crs = 4326,   na_color = "#0000",   layer_weight = 1.5,   layer_color = "#000000",   locked_districts = NULL,   use_algorithms = TRUE,   alg_max_districts = 3,   alg_max_sims = 100,   use_plans = TRUE,   use_comparisons = TRUE,   use_planscore = TRUE,   save_assignment_path = "redistio.csv",   save_shape_path = "redistio.geojson",   debounce = 150,   projection = "mercator",   plot_theme = ggplot2::theme_bw(),   plot_geom = "boxplot",   plot_ref_geom = NULL,   ... )

title: Set options for redistio — redistio_options
text: theme name bootswatch preset theme bslib::bs_theme() object panels panels display app, 'draw' always shown. select_color color use highlighting selected districts border_color color use precinct borders map palette_pop color palette use whole people. Defaults RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(n = 3, name = 'Purples'). palette_pct color palette use percentages people. Defaults RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(n = 3, name = 'PuOr'). palette_party color palette use parties map_tiles tileset use map background, leaflet::providers leaflet_height height pass leaflet::leafletOutput() crs coordinate reference system use leaflet::leaflet() na_color color use unassigned precincts layer_weight stroke width use layers leaflet::leaflet() layer_color colors use layers mapgl::maplibre() locked_districts districts lock app start stop edits use_algorithms whether use redistricting simulation algorithms alg_max_districts maximum number districts use algorithms alg_max_sims maximum number simulations use algorithms use_plans whether show plans browser tab plans provided use_comparisons whether show comparisons tab plans plans_fn provided use_planscore whether use PlanScore evaluate plans save_assignment_path Output path save assignment file . save_shape_path Output path save shapefile . debounce Number milliseconds debounce map hover events. Defaults 150. projection Maplibre projection use. Default 'mercator'. plot_theme ggplot2 theme apply comparison plots. Default ggplot2::theme_bw(). plot_geom geom use district-level comparison plots, passed geom argument redist::redist.plot.distr_qtys(). Can string like 'jitter' (default) ggplot2 geom function like ggplot2::geom_violin. plot_ref_geom geom function use reference plan overlay district-level comparison plots, passed ref_geom argument redist::redist.plot.distr_qtys(). function accepts .... ... additional arguments (currently ignored)

title: Set options for redistio — redistio_options
text: list

title: redistio 0.0.0.9001
text: Full rewrite mapgl instead leaflet. removes hacks around redrawing polygons. Package depends mapgl (>= 0.4.1) layer-based filtering, necessary fast precinct-level statistics.

title: redistio 0.0.0.9000
text: Adds primary draw panel interactive redistricting Adds demographics panel population details district Adds integrity panel assessing traditional redistricting criteria Adds elections panel summarizing partisan outcomes Adds algorithms panel using redist algorithms redraw subsets districts
